title: Joseph-Louis Lagrange
summary: Joseph-Louis Lagrange[lower-alpha 1] (born Giuseppe Luigi Lagrangia[5][lower-alpha 2] or Giuseppe Ludovico De la Grange Tournier;[6][lower-alpha 3] 25 January 1736 – 10 April 1813), also reported as Giuseppe Luigi Lagrange[7] or Lagrangia,[8] was an Italian mathematician and astronomer, later naturalized French. He made significant contributions to the fields of analysis, number theory, and both classical and celestial mechanics.
